PRPP

May 17, 2023 • Wenjian Liao, Zhizhong Lu

Rfam ID: nan(nan)


Timeline


start

  • Identification of ykkC motif that exhibit characteristics of riboswitch function

    2004[1]

  • Separation of ykkC subtype 2

    2017[2]

  • Further classification of ykkC subtype 2 as subtypes 2a through 2d and identification of ykkC subtype 2b RNAs as PRPP riboswitches

    2018[3]

  • Crystal structures of the PRPP riboswitch bound to PRPP

    2018[4]

  • Crystal structures of the PRPP riboswitch bound to PRPP

    2018[5]
2023...

Description

The ykkC RNAs were initially found in 2004 and in 2017,ykkC subtype 2 RNAs were separated from ykkC RNAs. Further analysis of the RNA sequences and consensus models of ykkC subtype 2 RNAs, and the assessment of the diverse types of genes found downstream of these RNAs, revealed that there are probably at least four additional distinct riboswitch classes present within the ykkC subtype 2 collection, termed ykkC subtypes 2a-2d. Phosphoribosyl pyrophosphate (PRPP, 5-phospho-α-D-ribose 1-diphosphate) was identified as the ligand for ykkC subtype 2b RNAs (PRPP riboswitches)[1-3].


Gene association

Representatives of PRPP riboswitch commonly associate with genes for de novo purine biosynthesis. The genes commonly asssociated with PRPP riboswitches are shown in orange [3].



Gene regulation

Putative mechanisms for regulation of gene expression by PRPP riboswitches[3].


Structure and Ligand recognition

2D representation

Left: Consensus sequence and secondary structure model for the PRPP riboswitch. Right: Secondary structure depictions of the PRPP riboswitch according to PDB ID: 6CK5[4].


Document


3D visualisation

The overall structure of the PRPP riboswitch was generated from PDB ID: 6CK5 at 2.49 Å resolution bound with PRPP. PRPP (shown in sticks) is labeled in red [4].
PDBe Molstar





Binding pocket

Left: Surface representation of the binding pocket of the PRPP riboswitch generated from PDB ID: 6CK5. PRPP (shown in sticks) is labeled in red. Right: The hydrogen bonds of the binding sites of the PRPP riboswitch bound with PRPP[4].

Ligand recognition

Chemical structures of PRPP. The apparent KD is shown on bottom[3, 4, 5].
